sponsor.partnerMessage: Emcar Stone Studio is a family-owned and operated full-service fabrication and installation company servicing NWA that specializes in residential/commercial: quartz, granite, marble, and quartzite countertops. Contact them today for a complimentary quote!

posts.title: Electronic Music Experience Coming To The Momentary
posts.content:
Dive into the digital music scene during Momentous, a four-day experience of electronic sound and art at the Momentary in Bentonville this week, Oct 20-24. 

  • Sounds: The first three nights will feature big names from the world of electronic music like Phong Tran, Four Tet, and Grammy-nominated Arca; then, a free show featuring local electronic artists will conclude the event on Sunday. 
  • Sights: Immerse yourself in a labyrinth-like sound sculpture, Rage Fluids by Hannah Perry, or the meditative environment, SUB by Kurt Hentschläger. 

Reserve your tickets for each night of Momentous HERE.

posts.title: Ozark Compost Makes Sustainable Living Easy
posts.content:
Ozark Compost & Swap is on a mission to make sustainable living convenient through doorstep composting and package-free product delivery. Already, the company has diverted over 20,000lbs of residential food waste from landfills. 

  • Composting: Ozark Compost & Swap does all the dirty work for you by delivering a 5-gallon bucket to your doorstep to be filled with compostable items, then picks up the bucket and swaps it for a clean one. All you have to do is choose a bi-weekly or weekly pick-up!
  • Refillable Products: The company offers refillable Airship coffee delivery and refillable household cleaning products in an effort to eliminate single-use plastics. 

Sign up HERE and use the discount code NWADAILY to receive a complimentary one-month trial of a bi-weekly pick-up.

posts.title: XNA Sees Surprisingly Successful September
posts.content:
Travel usually slows in September due to school starting up and a generally slower business season, but XNA just had their second-biggest September to date according to FareFlightNWA. 

  • Sweet September: Last month, 72,521 passengers boarded flights at XNA, making it the second-biggest September in the airport’s 24 year history behind 2019. 
  • On to October: XNA is picking up a few new direct options including Tampa, St. Pete-Clearwater, and Phoenix. However, Delta and United plan to drop their direct routes to NYC and Frontier will drop it’s route to Vegas. 

Stay up to date on airport news with FareFlightNWA HERE.

posts.title: Downtown Springdale’s Ozarktober Continues
posts.content:
Sweater weather vibes have taken over Downtown Springdale with two great events lined up for Ozarktober, both happening Saturday, Oct 22 from 4-8p. 

  • Brews & tunes: Celebrating local musicians and local breweries, don’t miss Brews & Tunes happening at Turnbow Park. 
  • Chalk walk: Take a stroll down the Chalk Walk to see an out of this world creation inspired by "El Galáctico” and curated by Kat Wilson.

Find a schedule of the various Ozarktober events HERE.

posts.title: Step Right Up For A Halloween Circus At Undercroft Bar
posts.content:
It's time to face your fear of clowns, because Undercroft’s Big Top, a creepy-circus themed popup event is taking over the coolest basement bar in Bentonville from Oct 17-31. 

  • Under what: Undercroft occupies the basement space of The Preacher’s Son in the beautifully-restored church building right off the square. 
  • Cirque de halloween: The classy cocktail bar is getting a Halloween-season makeover, themed after a spooky circus for the last two weeks of October. 

Walk-in’s are welcome, but you can skip the wait and make a reservation HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Engineered for success: Startup Junkie and Science Venture Studio are accepting applications for the 2023 EMPOWER Cohort, a 16-week accelerator for all women in STEM.* 
  • Uptown ghoul: Ladies, grab your favorite gal pals and head to Downtown Springdale for a Ghoul’s Night Out on Friday, Oct 21 from 6-9p. 
  • Watching grass grow: Fort Smith native, Trey Rogers, will help stadiums in the U.S. transition turf fields to natural grass in preparation for the 2026 FIFA World Cup. 
  • For for the family: Find all the family-friendly events going on this fall with Macaroni KID’s NWA Guide to Fall and Halloween Fun! 
  • Let's talk: Interested in advertising in the newsletter? Check out our deals HERE.

*Content is sponsored
